intro: Ruschia crassisepala, commonly known as the broad-sepaled Ruschia, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, upright stems and produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or red. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. It thrives in well-draining soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. This plant is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
